# CustomLocalizedStringResourceConvertible

**Protocol**

A type that provides an out-of-process localizable description.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol CustomLocalizedStringResourceConvertible
```

## Overview

Similar to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/CustomStringConvertible], types that conform to [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/CustomLocalizedStringResourceConvertible] provide their own representation when converting to a string instance. Whereas [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/CustomStringConvertible] provides a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/CustomStringConvertible/description] string, this type offers a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/LocalizedStringResource]. This allows out-of-process callers to create a localized description from the resource, possibly in a different locale than the current process uses.

## Describing a resource

- **localizedStringResource**: A resource that helps provide a description of this instance.

## Localization

- **Locale**: Information about linguistic, cultural, and technological conventions for use in formatting data for presentation.
- **NSOrthography**: A description of the linguistic content of natural language text, typically used for spelling and grammar checking.
- **NSLocalizedString(_:tableName:bundle:value:comment:)**: Returns a localized string from a table that Xcode generates for you when exporting localizations.
- **LocalizedStringResource**: A reference to a localizable string, accessible from another process.
- **URLResource**: A resource located at a particular file URL within a bundle.

## Conforming Types

- LocalizedStringResource
